aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Ratatouille Sheet Pan Dinner With Sausage

@graph.description: This sheet pan ratatouille recipe celebrates all of the olive-oil soaked flavors of the French country classic, but is bulked up into a one-pan meal thanks to the addition of hearty Italian sausages.
@graph.headline: Ratatouille Sheet Pan Dinner With Sausage
@graph.keywords: ratatouille sheet pan dinner with sausage,    spring, summer, fall, winter, diary-free, gluten-free, low-carb, whole-30, sheet-pan-meals
@graph.name: Ratatouille Sheet Pan Dinner With Sausage
@graph.recipeCategory: lunch, dinner, diary-free, gluten-free, low-carb, whole-30, sheet-pan-meals
recipeIngredient: 1 (20 oz) package mild Italian sausage (turkey, chicken, pork or vegan sausage substitute links)
4 garlic cloves, thinly sliced (or smashed and roughly chopped)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F.Place the onion, zucchini, yellow squash, eggplant, tomatoes and garlic on a rimmed baking sheet
Drizzle with ½ cup olive oil, sprinkle with salt and fresh thyme
Toss until evenly coated.Nestle the sausages into the veggies
Bake for 40 minutes until the vegetables are very tender and the sausage is browned
**Serve by its self or over our creamy polenta recipe

review.reviewBody: This recipe is quick, easy, and received rave reviews.  I used sweet Italian chicken sausage and just a sprinkle of raw sugar before baking.  Chopped the eggplant rather than rings.
Definitely a tasty way to incorporate a lot of veggies! We've made this a couple times and like to add in mushrooms.

Another favorite from your site - we've made it twice this month already trying different flavors of chicken sausage. THANK YOU for posting such easy, healthy, fast and most importantly YUMMY recipes! I'm officially hooked on you site!

@graph.description: Holly Erickson and Natalie Mortimer became friends over a shared love for food and hosting. The Modern Proper exists to empower people to cherish their loved ones and feed them well by providing a large library of beautiful and delicious recipes.
@graph.name: The Modern Proper
